summary: The Green Tape Elimination Act of 2025 aims to exempt hazardous fuel reduction activities on federal land from certain environmental regulations for a 10-year period. It would exempt these activities from the National Environmental Policy Act and various environmental laws such as the Endangered Species Act, the National Historic Preservation Act, and the Migratory Bird Treaty Act. The bill defines "hazardous fuel" and "hazardous fuel reduction activities". It also includes a provision amending the Clean Air Act to exclude certain air quality monitoring data related to these activities.
